basics.name: Bernard Hernandez
basics.label: Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer
basics.summary: Proven expertise in the end-to-end development of data-driven applications and clinical decision support tools to tackle challenges in healthcare, including antimicrobial resistance and diagnosis of infectious diseases. Passionate about translating complex research into practical, impactful AI solutions for global health challenges.

location.address: B420 Bessemer building, South Kensington Campus

work.name: Imperial College London, Department of Medicine
work.summary: The Centres for Antimicrobial Optimisation Network (CAMO-NET) funded by Wellcome brings together research teams from the University of Liverpool and Imperial College London in the United Kingdom, the University of Cape Town in South Africa, the Infectious Diseases Institute in Uganda, and the Faculty of Medicine at the University of Sao Paulo in Brazil to conduct research to optimize antimicrobial use and improve access to effective treatment for bacterial infections across low-, middle-, and high-resource settings.

work.name: Imperial College London, EEE Department
work.summary: Artificial Intelligence and machine learning to devise clinical decision support systems (CDSS) from clinical, physiological and imaging data for the early identification of dengue in low- and middle-income countries.
highlights: Featured innovative start-up at Tech Foresight 2040.
Techcelerate award (entrepreneurial program), 2020.

work.name: Imperial College London, EEE Department
work.summary: Development of a comprehensive and modular data-driven web-based intelligent decision support system to help clinicians prescribe the most appropriate antibiotics at the point of care.

work.name: WIDE IO LTD
work.summary: Start-up working on disruptive products within the quadrangle of Artificial Intelligence, API, IoT, and FinTech to build an ecosystem of data science tools within the cloud to allow organisations to have constant access to state-of-art technology.

work.name: IRILL (internship)
work.summary: Internship at the Center for Innovation and Research on Free Software (IRILL) under the Leonardo program, 2012. The aim of this one-month internship was to develop e-learning resources such as blog entries, ebooks and games.
